data.text:
@RichardfromSyd1 @BigBadDenis @CollignonPeter It can be hard to keep up with all the data and current recommendations.

I find @Globalbiosec and @CrabbBrendan to be reliable sources of Covid19 information and advice, they seem to be on top of all the relevant data.
@BigBadDenis @CollignonPeter Why? This LNP government wants a reduction in the number of old people and pensioners and all is going to plan

@_SharonThornton @BigBadDenis @CollignonPeter There has also been (at least initially from the Feds) messaging that a booster was "nice to have" with one of the Deputy CMOs getting up and saying that 2 dose protection vs serious was excellent, and 3rd dose mainly to control transmission.

But 3rd dose critical for elderly https://t.co/JmV922t8yI

@BigBadDenis @CollignonPeter How about advocating for putting back in place the original Public health measures like mandatory masking and improving ventilation and buying the vaccines /procurement for under 5s @CollignonPeter and WFH if possible. Cases are rising again in NSW

@RichardfromSyd1 @BigBadDenis @CollignonPeter The messaging from some of the govt health department advisers has been misleading. Opening up and removing virtually all mitigations gave the message to some that everything was safe now. They may see no urgency to get boosted as they have been told they are safe.
@BigBadDenis @CollignonPeter Zero-Covid seems to be the thought trajectory of those who like to pretend that Covid19 isn't a major problem in Australia.

@BigBadDenis @CollignonPeter Well he right about that.

Pity the federal government is keeping secret the age breakdown of booster doses - so we can’t see how we are going there.

@BigBadDenis @CollignonPeter Messaging that pushed for opening up borders, workplaces, etc. without retaining safety measures, like N95's indoors, may have led some to believe they are not at risk for Covid19.
